text: This ramen spot is on par with some of the best ones in town. The service was great, food was excellent, and the pricing was on point. The portions were massive as well. I really liked the vibe inside too. Really hip place, with great music. My only suggestion would be to have fresh iced green tea but that's just if I'm nit-picking. 6/5 would come again.
Solid good bowl of tonkatsu ramen! They char chashu, it's delicious and makes the experience a lil Smokey. Egg was cooked perfectly. Takoyaki was also yum! Off the strip, good price and yummy food!
Was in town for a 3-day Seminar. Chose this place for lunch on day 2 and so glad I did! The flavors of EVERY INGREDIENT exploded on my taste buds! Great job Joey and team!!

This is a fast food ramen restaurant.  The service was fast and friendly. 
I had the Tonkatsu ramen. The portion was large but the broth was only warm.  I told my server and she took notice.  For $10.00 this place is not bad considering it's a fast food restaurant. I was in and out in 20 minutes.

I'm always on the hunt for a good veggie ramen. I have been driving past this place every day on the way home from work and finally decided to give it a shot. 

I got the In Bloom and added an egg. Didn't come with the roasted tomato like the menu describes. The broth was pretty watery and not very flavorful. 

I ordered takoyaki with my order and it didn't arrive until 13 minutes AFTER I got my ramen. At least this was on par with takoyaki at other ramen places around town. 

I'm definitely disappointed. Not sure I will return.
Hard to make a bad bowl of noodles. Bland and I have more flavor from the ramen packet at home...cool ambiance but that's about it.

Ramen seems like the best cure for a hangover. Before heading home we found this place. The restaurant was packed around 1PM but it was a short wait 15 min wait to get seated. First impression of the place was great, I loved the decor and artwork. Servers were really nice but very forgetful in our orders, had a few mistakes. I finished my ramen before my other two friends got theirs. I wanted to like this place but the ramen broth was just too salty. Maybe after a few more months it will get better. They get an A for effort!

Yum!  We stopped by during the soft opening (seriously, if you want to eat well for a fraction of the price, walk a ways from the Strip).  I'd never had fried chicken in ramen and it was a winner.  If the music situation is the same, you may feel like you're in a Good Charlotte/Green Day concert.  :)

I really enjoyed the flavor of the miso spicy ramen. They use pork belly which I don't like, but they were willing to substitute it for many other options. They were very ackmodating to my pickyness.  I prefer the ground pork chacho but they don't offer that. I would recommend this place if you are nearby and craving ramen. Customer service is good as well.
Sooooooo good! Definitely coming back. Great service!! I got the Shinya to heaven. The pork was perfect & there was so much flavor.

I got the "Shoyu What Tonkatsu Ramen" for $10 and it was just what I expect out of my ramen. I like it comforting and there were plenty of toppings to fill me up with. The portion of cha siu is pretty thick, but it was a little cold. The broth was pretty nice and mild as well. My bf had eaten previously, but was curious to taste the karaage that is used as a topping for the Fried Chicken ramen. He enjoyed it with the spicy chili dressing and describes the chicken as tender and juicy. 
The ambiance was very trendy. There was a lot of throwback songs to early 2000's, which just brought me back. The two waitresses that served us were super attentive and accommodating.
Although I still prefer Monta Ramen for its simple and flavorful and affordable ramen, I love the convenience of this ramen shop to UNLV. Overall, I had a pleasant experience and would come again.

This place just popped up on my Yelp radar so I had to come try it out.  It's been open for just over a month so it wasn't too crowded but I think that'll change soon once word gets out. Hands down the best ramen I've had in vegas!  I always order the Karaage chicken and Tonkatsu ramen (I asked for spicy and got just that!) so I can compare it to other places.  The chicken was cooked perfectly, crispy on the outside and moist on the inside . The dipping sauce  was a delicious spicy mayo based sauce.  The ramen broth was rich and spicy, just how I like it. The noodles were cooked perfectly and portion size was good. 
The service was excellent. Our server was friendly and attentive. The food arrived quickly, prices were great and the atmosphere was cool too.  Nice trendy decor with hand painted murals done by a local tattoo artist. The whole experience was great. I can't wait to come back and experience more of the menu!

Walked in during a lunch break and I was greeted and welcomed by a very nice guy. He pretty much helped me decide what to order cos I was very indecisive. The chicken was the best Ive ever had at a ramen place. My goodness my mouth just waters thinking about it. I was impressed by the fancy take out bags too. Love it!

I will say with a soft opening under their belt,  some things still need to be worked out. I know the challenges of training help. Although the place was very slow. I don't think the waitress needed to take my water, ramen bowl check and spices all at once. Maybe leave the water so I could finish drinking it. So I felt like I had to rush out. It was still a pleasant enough experience. I opted for the Vegan ramen and got the wide egg noodles instead of kale noodles. The flavor was good. But I have to say $11 for a veggie ramen seems rather pricey.  As a result, I will not make this a regular stop. The menu names are creative and fun. But as an Izakaya the menu seems very limited.
This place just rocks, friendly staff, great food. Will come back again with a crowd.

The ambience of this place is phenomenal! Very modern and neat looking. The art on the walls were very unique. It is like a traditional ramen house, not a whole lot of space in there, but I feel like that's all of them. The staff was quick with our food as well friendly. In terms of price, it is pretty competitive to all of the other places nearby. As a foodie in Vegas I have went to Jinya, Fukimimi, as well as Sora. As their ideas are great and the people are nice, the ramen is just not up to par as the places listed above. The broth and noodles were very bland. Both me and my girlfriend got two different types of ramen and we both thought the same thing.

They said we arrived while they were still in their soft opening. The Ramen was great. My friend and I both got Tonkatsu to Heaven and added an egg. So yummy! Definitely hit the spot. Loved the noodles, loved the broth, loved the chashu (pork slices) and overall great price.

Came on a slow Monday night with my BF and food was okay and service was meh. 

FOOD 3/5
Wanted to try fried calamari squid legs but they were sold out so we had the the takoyaki instead which wasn't fresh and had barely noticeable squid. 
I had the "let's get physical" fried chicken ramen which was good, chicken was crispy and the added spice paste really made the meal worth it. 
My boyfriend had the "Shinya way to heaven" which he thought was Ok. It has the creamy broth with added spicy paste and the chasu was thick and delicious. 

SERVICE 
2/5
Food came out kinda slow and since we were the only ones there at first, our server didn't check on us very often and kept going back to the kitchen. Took another 5 minutes before we could eat because we didn't receive spoons. We noticed that other diners after us were taken care of and done before us. It took another 10 min to get our check, and when I asked about the free topping for yelp checkin the server didn't know what to do so had to go back and talk to the manager on duty who apparently was unaware about it & it took longer to update our check. Our final check only gave us 1 discount topping when the manager noted that we had two for both our check ins. We didn't bother trying to fix it because it wasn't worth having to wait another 10 min for the server to notice us again.

ATMOSPHERE
5/5 I really liked the inside decor, pretty artistic wall art that gave a young hip vibe to the place. I enjoyed the fun creative names for all the menu items. The music selection is on point. Good EDM choices. 

Overall, the ambience of the place hyped me up for the experience but the food and service was very underwhelming so probably won't come here again.
There are better ramen places in town.
Fried chicken ramen is really unusual, never heard of it before, so I tried it. It was great, I was surprised how good it was. Music was good, nice atmosphere, not crowded. We will come back.
Amazing food! Ordered the chashu pork and my gf Ordered the miso ramen and they were amazing!!!! Recommended. Good service, and good atmosphere as well!!

Cool little ramen shop off strip. Its up there for one of the best ramen broths I have had and they pack your bowl to the brim!! I ordered the Karaage Ramen (forgot the name) and the chicken was crispy and juicy with the perfect amount of seasoning, plus the broth is delicious. The best part is the price, its so cheap for such good quality.

The place is kinda small but the decor is really trendy and cool. They just opened so theres not much business yet but with good food like theirs. I expect more people to hear about them

The menu names are one of the most creative and funniest ones I have ever seen lol.

The quality of the food is outstanding!! I got the Call Me Chicken Karaage appetizer and the Shoyu What Tonkatsu Ramen. The chicken karaage is flavorful and fresh, and the ramen hits the spot for any ramen lover. I really respect the employees for their kindness and quick service. I definitely recommend this place for the ramen lover and for people who want to fill their stomachs .

Trendy newcomer! Looks like most other ramen shops with cool artwork. Their light installment in the middle was what I liked most. 

I had their fried chicken ramen. The broth was amazing at first taste! Then after a few more plus eating the fried chicken, it just got a little too salty.
Great place for a Ramen and it was very tasty.  I never thought to get Ramen in Las Vegas but you must try it.

Solid little, hip ramen spot.  Off strip a bit so away from the hustle and bustle. Ramen was on point and flavors were all there.  Tsukemen could be a little thicker but definitely worth checking out.  Inexpensive price point and great service.  No alcohol.  Definitely be back!

I consider myself a ramen enthusiast. This place is cool but, its just another fancy'pop ramen joint that *looks* nice and sells you the vibe. The ramen is good (I like how they make the chashu but the I'm not a fan of the thin noddles) the gyoza is crispy (if you like that). 2 stars bc theres much better (and cheaper) places in town. But, if you're a tourist go here. This place is for you. Locals -Get something better

I had chicken double trouble with spicy paste . It was SOOOO good. I had to force myself to stop eating ir because it was so flavorful . Its a very nice and dark environment and im glad because nobody realized i was getting broth all over and nobody could see me stuff my faace like a pig.

This place has good ramen.  It has the thick broth, deliciously crisp chashu pork and cooked to perfection noodles.  We ordered the chicken karaage to start and it came with a savory garlic sauce. Too bad we don't live in Vegas, otherwise this would be my new favorite ramen place.  I'm giving it 4 stars only because they were out of quite a few items.

House music and hand-painted art on the walls make this place more fun than your average strip-mall ramen joint. The food and service didn't disappoint. I had the Shoyu Ramen, which came out within only a few minutes so I was surprised at how wonderful it tasted. The chashu has grill marks, which I almost never see. The egg was done perfectly as was the tofu. The broth could have been a little hotter, but I thought it was a great product especially consultant the place just opened. I will go again.

came here for lunch today and ordered the "shoyu what tonkatsu ramen". the menu said that it comes with black (garlic) oil, it may have been just one drop of oil but i didn't taste any garlic at all. they were quite stingy with their chashu; two tiny slices and i was able to devour it with one bite. my colleague ordered the "let's get physical - fried chicken ramen". the bowl definitely lived up to its name. i mean, i eat slow.. but i was still able to finish my bowl before she did. she was spent majority of her time trying to eat the chicken aka getting physical. hahah.

Cute place, very modern decor in the restaurant. The restaurant wasn't as busy when we went during lunch time. The server was great though, walked us through the menu when he learned that this was our first time, and recommended us that "Let's get physical" was one of their most popular dishes. It is like fried chicken with chicken broth and a marinated egg? The chicken was so flavorful and tender!  Noodles were cooked well too, broth was a bit on the salty side, but it is flavor definitely tasted like it has been simmering for a while full of that chicken bone flavor!  The egg though was... "interesting", not my favorite thing in the dish, lol it tasted "marinated" that is for sure. I would say it is a decent ramen place, maybe not the number 1 but great ramen for the price! Cute place to check out for a date, or with friends!

On a Sunday afternoon I took my parents to Fukumimi for ramen, but as usual the wait was long and Chinatown so far away. Right as my dad asked why no one else is capitalizing on the ramen craze on the east side, my mom remembered that Shinya had just opened near the Hard Rock, so we decided to try it out. 

Shinya is quite a bit bigger than most ramen shops in town, but not exceedingly so. There was one other party there when we arrived and we were seated and greeted quickly. We ordered a couple Sapporos on draft ($2 opening special right now) as well as an order of the shishito peppers. The peppers were plentiful, with thinly shaved bonito on top that added a bit of tang to the sweet and charred peppers. I ordered the miso ramen, my mom had the tonkatsu shoyu and my dad had the chicken karaage bowl. 

Shinya offers 6 types of ramen, 3 of which are more "traditional" (shio, miso, and tonkatsu), and the other 3 are bit more unusual (fried chicken, chicken, and vegan). I was happy to see they ventured out of the standard toppings as well, offering a fish cake and bamboo shoots with my miso. The ramen had maybe slightly less noodles than some other restaurants, as I was easily able to finish the bowl. The broth had a decent amount of kick, though I did ask for some chili oil to go along with it. The chashu though was absolutely gigantic. They give you two thick pieces that are probably 5-6" long. My dad's karaage bowl was a bit small, but for $4 it's a good snack. They asked if he wanted any sauces with it and brought out 3 different types for him to try which I thought was a little odd. Why not just serve the bowl with sauces anyways? 

Overall Shinya is a much welcomed, much less busy ramen spot in a newly renovated strip mall across from Hard Rock. I don't see much of a reason to have to go to Fukumimi anymore, unless I need tan tan men. Hopefully more people give Shinya a try and it can succeed.

I was excited to eat here but was very disappointed in the menu. The menu is very basic and I hate the names of the ramen it makes it feel very unauthentic. But I thought I'd give it a try since I seen some reviews and supposedly it's the best ramen in town!!! But I ordered the fired chicken ramen and there was no flavor. I needed to add so much chili paste to give the broth some type of taste. And the broth to me tastes very powdery. I hope that it was just a bad night and that's not really how their ramen taste.
Food and service was excellent!  The food is super affordable and it's right across from Hard Rock Hotel and Casino.
New place with delicious food and very friendly wait staff. Lots of choices.  Will eat here again.

Miso soup was spicy (as indicated on the menu) but when I asked if I can get it not spicy they said no problem. I got the miso ramen, which is for my little nephew by the way, the color was already off. It was spicy and they said that Miso is actually spicy itself. Whaat? That was a let down. Please know your product and when you say you can do something actually do it! Gyoza was good but not extraordinary.

This review is for 3.5 stars.

As this was a soft opening, I expected some hiccups.  But overall the waitress seemed to be so overwhelmed and a real novice.  She didn't write anything down and inevitably screwed up both of our dishes.  Chicken in mine, pork in hers, no corn in hers, thin noodles in mine.  Little things that could have easily been taken care of if the order was written down.

When the food came out correctly, both the chickan and tonkatsu broth was a little meaty but tasty.  Mild spice although we asked for double spicy paste.  There were too many noodles for my liking, but this might appeal to other ramen eaters out there.  Noodles were very thin and just your typical variety.  As far as the meat goes, both the pork and chicken were outstanding.  The chicken was more a shredded or rotisserie, rather than chashu.  The pork was thick pork belly and really grilled to perfection.  The rest of the ramen accompaniments were just average, complete with onion, bamboo shoot, and egg (and added corn for $1).  

Because of our fiasco with the food, the manager thankfully gave us a discount due to growing pains of the new restaurant.  It's really a nice and simple gesture to bring a customer back.  For the meat alone, Shinya Maru could be worth another go; maybe to try a rice bowl instead.  Nice to have one near the strip on this side of town, but there are surely still better options either in China Town or Southwest.

The Vegas joint for ramen! This was our first breakfast spot the morning after edc and I loved the food and drinks. Joey was also such a sweetheart (our sever/ manager). Attention to details is 100% at Shinya Maru and thank you for the great food and kind hearted spirits you have.
The ramen was delicious. Service was friendly and nice. The rice plate could use a little bit of work but overall not bad. I would recommend everyone try this ramen house.

If you are too far away from jinya, a UNLV student, or waiting for jinya to reopen from renovations (update: they reopened 03/16/17) you can go to shinya! Think of them as the knock off brand of jinya. Not as good as jinya, but pretty damn close. The chashu is BOMB!!!! Better than jinya honestly. If I'm craving a midnight snack near campus, this is the place to go.

This is my second time here.  The first time i thought it just might have been an off night but boy i was wrong. Has to be the most bland soup base I've ever had for ramen.  More flavor in a packet of top ramen. They really need to change it because it's disgusting. Broth smelled like feet yuck.  i returned the ramen and manager refused to refund.  She said they could replace with equivalent but that doesn't exactly work if your ramen base sucks. Waitress staff is pleasant though. Do yourself a favor and go spring mountain for the real deal

We came here for the first time late Wednesday evening and WOW what an awesome start to our Vegas trip! :D

SERVICE - Our server was very friendly and gave us great recommendations for appetizers. Food came out fast!

AMBIENCE/DECOR - Casual with a very cozy feel. Love the decor and lighting. They have tables for 2 or 4 and a long table in the center which can accommodate larger groups.

FOOD - Everything was delicious with good portions and great pricing! If you're not starving one appetizer is definitely enough to share between 2 people plus ramen. We were STUFFED with our two appetizers!

[AGEDASHI TOFU] - $5.50/4pcs - A little too much soy sauce but the tofu had the perfect texture. The outside crunchy layer was thicker and more chewy than others I've had. Loved this! HIGHLY RECOMMEND. Just ask for less sauce or have it on the side.

[EYE OF THE TAKOYAKI] - $5/5pcs - Delicious and VERY filling. 

[KILLING MISO SOFTLY] - $11 - The chasu pork was PERFECTION. Loved the spicy flavor. Broth was a bit too salty but very tasty. I wonder if they had low-sodium option? 

[SHOYU WHAT TONKATSU] - $10 - Your typical shoyu ramen. Very flavorful broth.

Great Tonkatsu Ramen! Perfect balance of flavors. I was happy to see this place open up right here since I moved back to the strip. 

Interior is nicely decorated and dimly lit. 

Music is perfect for me - late 90's early 2000's rock music 

Waitresses were cute and nice

This place is deliciously and surprisingly good for being in a sketchy area which is located at the end of the strip. 
The ramen soups have many varieties. I had two kinds which one is called let's get physical and the other one stairway to heaven. The broth is rich in flavor, creamy melted in the noodles. The physical one is chicken broth but creamy rich and the other one is pork flavor and creamy. Definitely worth going here but just be aware of your surroundings lol.

The ramen is very average. I had asked for the broth to be spicy, but it seemed to lack any heat or flavor (outside of the green onions, which were piled on top). Additionally, it was a bit colder than expected. 

The creaminess and portion size were on point. I ordered an extra egg and together with the toppings that came with the shoyu tonkotsu bowl, I was filled. 

The service was quick and attentive. If you don't mind sharing space with others around a large table, we were seated in less than 20 mins on a Sunday night.

Short and simple.  We came here on a Monday night looking to fill our tummy to a nice bowl of ramen after a long 3 days of EDC. We chose Shinya Maru Ramen because it was the closest from where we were staying and it looked pretty good on yelp. 

SERVICE: It was ok. The food was slow coming out and they even forgot to give us chopsticks and soup spoon for our ramen.  

FOOD: 
Chicken Karaage: Well season, nice lighty battered, but well over cook and very dry.

Killing Miso Softly: Not to good. The broth was very bland. The noodles were hard and chewy. Just a disappointing bowl of ramen. 

Sorry Shinya.
Wonderful ramen and a great environment. There are 5 great ramen options with lots of add-ons. Service is great - nice, quick.
Great food, the pork in the Shinya pork ramen was tender and flavorful complementing the noodles and broth. Order the calamari over the octopus if you're feeling a little seafood for appetizer.

Tl;DR: Absolutely amazing food, $2 coedo & sapporo pint specials rn, cute space and great music. Seriously just stop reading, hop in your car, and go now!!

The bf and I just finished our first night at our first ever EDC so naturally we were starving. We're also huge ramen fiends. This place is new so a lil low on ratings, we decided to give it a chance since it was so close to our hotel.

They've done a great job with the interior, it feels like a cozy hip izakaya in San Francisco it's almost a bit of a shock when you step back outside into a Vegas shopping center.

Idk if the owners just always have good taste in music or if they know the clientele for the weekend but they had A+ music playing. Never gonna complain about Tycho and ODESZA. 

Hands down best tonkotsu broth I've ever had. I got the Shinya and bf got the Shoyu. I liked his a little better tbh. No skimpy thin chashu here, the pieces they give are thick and cooked perfectly, so flavorful! 

We also got the agedashi tofu, which is one of my bfs favs and he was very impressed. 

Honestly we're both really really sad this place is in Vegas and not back home in Cali ;A;
Great staff and great food. You have to try the Fried Chicken! Whether it be the noodles or a rice bowl. Saving this places in my bookmark for the next Vegas trip.

I must say...I am coming back for the service more so than the food. I came to shinya for the first time and I wasn't too sure on how to order Ramen correctly, but the supervisor,  Karen? I think it was Karena helped me and explained the menu wonderfully. My food did come out incorrectly; however, she was very quick to get the issue fixed right away. I've never seen a supervisor work hand in hand with their severs like she does.  She possesses a great deal of professionalism and is so personable with her guests. She really made me feel comfortable and I am looking forward to coming back again !

A very very pleasent surprise! We went to our usual Ramen place and did not want to wait 40 minutes in line.  Remembered seeing Shinya a couple months back and decided to give it a try.  It def did not disappoint! The ramen noodles were good, toppings plentiful.
Also tried the shishito peppers which were wonderful.
Will go back again

Coming from LA I didn't have much expectations coming into some ramen shop in Las Vegas. I would say food here was actually comparable to ramen that I enjoy in LA. I like that this place has options that are not too basic (although I went with the first item on the menu). Pork broth was hearty and rich!! It certainly helped with the hangover. Fried calamari and takoyaiki here was also amazinggg try some and also if you like watching the bonito flakes move like they're alive lol
Killing Miso Softly is absolutely delicious. Must try for those who enjoy a spicy dish. If not, try Shoyu What Tonkotsu Is. Yummy!!!
Tonkutso ramen was excellent and yummy, not salty. Takoyaki was good too. I will definitely be back here.

First time to this place and definitely won't be the last. Their takoyaki is really good. I tried the Shoyu Ramen And it was okay. The soup was really thick and flavorful and Rich but it feels like something is missing. I definitely would be back to try the other items on the menu. Service though is really excellent!

the food is good but the service is slow...
it took forever to get an order of mochi to our table
utensil on the table are dirty.

Maybe I had come in on a bad day because the hostess and the owner had politely explained that they they are still in their early stages of a soft opening and that they did not have running water from the night before. However, it was one of the worst ramen I have ever tasted. It was bland and a cup of noodles probably had more flavor. 

Although the service to a very long time (mind that we were on a one hour work lunch) but the server always checked up on us to apologize for the long wait. 

I think they should improve the broth and also add more choices. I know this is a soft opening so I was not expecting too much, but instead some decent ramen. As for right now, this would be my review. I might take the extra effort to try to come back and see if anything changes - maybe then I will go and update my review.

This place is one of my favorite restaurants in Vegas. I normally don't have much time to get food in Vegas and me and my group decided to stop by here because we were just hungry. But we were pretty blown away by this place. The food was good and reasonable priced. We all got different things, I got the chasu pork bowl. It was a big portion and the chasu was so tender! I like that they added some sort of furitake on the rice to add flavor. The restaurant aesthetic was on point too. Our server, Taylor, was also really attentive and nice. I would definitely come back here next time when I come to Vegas!

Oh man, my usual spot was closed so I decided to try this place. Omg the chashu in my ramen was delicious! Best chashu I've eaten, definitely will be back. 5 Stars 

Edit: I went back. The Ramen was watered down and the chashu wasn't as flavorful. I get it, it's a new place. So maybe I'll come back in a month. They gave us a free Ramen and a takoyaki as compensation though! Really nice people.

Came to Shinya Maru when they first opened and that was a 1 star experience(That star is for the staff being so nice). The food was below average. Broth was way too salty, noodles were too chewy, chashu was ok (was just marinated meat cut up in pieces). They had a tsukemen ramen that was basically served with sesame dressing that left me thinking "who the hell thought of this? This isn't tsukemen" Real disappointment.

Fast foward to 3 months later, the ramen is a complete 180. The shinya way to heaven broth was absolutely delicious. It was rich, flavorful, but not heavy or fatty. The black garlic oil they add elevates the flavor of the broth. It comes with a perfect soft boiled egg & 2 thick pieces of chashu. The chashu to me was the best part of the dish. Probably the best chashu I've had in Vegas. Definitely would order extra pieces next time.

The staff here is really friendly and pretty attentive. The manager Nate came out & talked to us a little bit. We had told him about the past experience here & how this visit changed our mind about this place. Glad we gave this place a second chance, we found our new go to ramen spot.

This place is wonderful!!! Super cute inside and the staff is very friendly. I am addicted to ramen so I was so excited when this little ramen place opened up across the street from my work. It did not disappoint! I love the Shoyu What Tonkatsu ramen and the tonkatsu way to heaven is delish as well (their menu items have the cutest names. (i.e. I've been waiting for a gyoza like you) will be coming here frequently even in the summer. I'll try some of their cold noodles and rice bowls
Service is good. All they have are beers and sake. The ramen is pretty blah. I wish we would have just went to JINYA. They have so many more add ons and a much better selection. Never again.

Tried this place out sense we stayed next door and after edc week we NEEDED our ramen fix that would fix us right up before the drive back home to LA. It's a nice small place with cool rock inspired main items and rock painting. I tried the Chicken Double Trouble and the broth was to die for and I love how it came with a lot of green onion  and on the side I got Another Chicken the Wall which is a chicken with rice bowl. Everything is totally reasonable pricing very good portions. This place is a must when I'm back in Vegas
I really enjoyed the chicken over rice and the charsue ramen. I would go back.

Ramen had a nice presentation, service was fine but ramen was very bland. Chicken was bland. Packaged top ramen has more flavor. I was very disappointed.  Noodles were just ok as well. Overall definitely not impressed and there are a lot of better places now in the city to get ramen. I ate about 80% of it and paid and left. It wasn't worth the money. This place is not ready to compete.

One word can describe the ramen I had here: satisfactory.

It was enough to fill you up, but I honestly felt like there was a lot to de desired. If comparing Shinya to what else is found in the Las Vegas market, you'll find there's are much better options for the same price. From the atmosphere, noodle quality, broth, and ingredients-- I felt as though I was eating an overpriced bowl of street vendor ramen in a place attempting to be the next hip thing. There's better ramen out there, but if you need something in the area, this is just enough to be satisfied.

New Ramen across the street from Hard Rock on Harmon and Paradise!

Gave the Shoyu Tonkotsu Ramen and Fried Chicken Ramen a go...the former being a very rich and heavy broth, served a bit cooler in temp than the noodles, plenty of depth with the corn and misc.  Chasu itself cut very thick, pork belly like, fat not rendered as well as preferred but with a delicious char that holds well in the broth.  

Fried Chicken Ramen served as boneless nuggets, not as heavily seasoned as the Karaage starter which leaned salty but tasty....The broth not nearly as interesting as the Tonkotsu.  

Still a good bowl at a reasonable price, considering your closest competition is a $50 bowl at Momofuku.  Recommended!

Came here after a show around 10:30 pm.  We both ordered the Shinya Way to Heaven ramen.  Not sure if it was late and they were running low on broth, but our ramen had very little broth.  The chasu pork was on the dry side and each bowl had exactly 2 bamboo shoots.  My husband ordered a beer but it never came.  He saw their keg giving out so he knew but our waitress never told him until he asked.  When the bill came, she charged us for the beer and also the free 1 topping Yelp check-in offer.  Meh...was not impressed with the food or the service.

The vegan ramen was AMAZING! Even my non-vegan friends were raving about it. I also had the fried tempura appetizer which was basically heaven in the form of perfect salty goodness and textures. The atmosphere was inviting, and the price was inexpensive for the quality and ingenuity of the food. Everyone should get a taste of the most bomb ramen in town!

I really enjoyed the Ramen here. It's a really hip and fun environment and they have some very catchy names for the ramen. I had the killing miso softly and broth was very flavorful and the chasu was just right. Its right by hard rock and unlv so the location is perfect for me. I will definitely be back soon.

No pork broth, no lemonade...I mean thats pivotal being that their menu isn't extensive. Waiter said it's due to them "just opening". I remember reading on Yelp they had a soft opening in February, she confirmed. I said "it's April, it's getting HARD now". 
Soup was bland, service was cool I guess. 
Definitely not coming back and sticking to Ramen Sora. 
I see the makings of a ramen papaya king here. Set up to fail. This intersection is unforgiving. Good food or go home!!!

Great food, cool atmosphere! I had the fried chicken ramen and my wife had the miso, that's sweet and spicy! Both were delicious, with large portions! Edamame is a good bargain too for how inexpensive it is! Our server didn't know we were newlyweds but they still surprised us and brought a free Mochi! Great place and will be back

Agedashi tofu is near perfect. Gyoza are deep fried Chinese style. Not Japanese at all. Don't order them. yuck. Shishitoo peppers are okay. Never seen them in a light egg batter. Maybe supposed to be tempura??? Not sure. Service is excellent, friendly and fast.   The servers work hard to please everyone. Impressive. I'll try the ramen next time.

Ramen, ramen, ramen!! The only other thing you need to know is if it was good or not. I had the vegan ramen it's called "In Bloom" and its fricken tasty according to me. Noodles, corn, green onion and tofu. The broth is a rather mild vegetable flavor that I livened up a bit with the house hot sauce. So yes....it was rather satisfying and delicious to say the least. I accompanied my soup with a side of white rice and I love rice so I have to say the rice was delicious as well. So that's my rice sales pitch. 
 The windows are fully blacked out and it almost looked closed when I walked up the neon open sign is above the doors and does not stand out well. As I walked through the doors my eyes were very pleased with the decor and artistic stylings incorporated from wall to wall. Very cool mural style paintings adorn the dining area walls, restroom doors and even on the restroom walls. The men's bathroom door has a super, cool ass, life size painting of Sid Vicious and the women's has Nancy....I think? It kind of looks like Madonna to me so I'm not quite sure. I didn't ask because the girls working seemed very young and may not have even understood my question. I included pics let me know what you think. I like the reclaimed wood on the walls, the hanging light bulb lamps and wood benches. Dimly lit and cozy feeling. 
  Oh yeah and as far as the girls working....first of all I had the whole place to my self so I had all the attention, which is fine with me. Both the young ladies were very kind and friendly and checked in with me to make sure I had all I needed and/or wanted. 
 My first impression and overall experience went well. I recommend giving them a try!

Yum! I was looking to carb-load before going out so I chose the pork chasu bowl. It was cheap and did the trick! The pork chasu was just the right amount of sauce and salty, and the rice was perfect. My boyfriend got the fried chicken ramen, which was an entirely new concept as I've never seen fried chicken in a ramen before. When he was ordering I warned him that the fried chicken might get soggy because of the soup but he ordered anyways. Surprisingly it was really good combined with the flavors of the soup. The food came out very quickly and the waitress, Karina, was super sweet. I didn't really like the rock music they played but I it was cool. Overall a great experience I would go back for!

We were on this side of town so decided to check out this ramen spot.  Modern/trendy decor, on the smaller side for a restaurant.  The takoyaki was really good, super crispy on the outside and soft and pillow like on the inside.  We also ordered the shinya way to heaven, the tonkatsu ramen with black garlic oil with extra chashu. Don't forget to check in on yelp for a free ramen topping.  The broth was decent, the chashu was maybe a little chewier than I prefer.  The size of the bowl is decent and filling even without the extra chashu.  We asked for the thicker noodles, but honestly it seemed like thin noodles when it arrived.  My biggest complaint is the noodles are way overcooked and the broth wasn't piping hot.  Seems like this place has potential, but I prefer Fukumimi on this side of town over this place.  We didn't get a chance to try the macaron ice cream sandwiches since we were in a hurry, but they look legit.

Coming from Los Angeles, I would compare the Ramen from this place as subpar. You could say that maybe are standards are higher, for a reason that we have visited a lot of ramen places at Los Angeles. I ordered the Killing Miso Softly and it was really salty and oily. My husband and 2 daughters had the Double Trouble and Shinya Way to Heaven. It was bland and the broth wasn't tasty. It tastes more like water (according to my eldest). One thing I noticed that is important with having ramen is the temperature of the soup.  The soup was warm, but not hot like it should be. My family was really disappointed. At the same time we hated the meat. It was sliced thick and fatty (yikes!!!). To be fair, we loved their Takoyaki! I would probably not go back to this place again. I drank 3 glasses of water just to finish my bowl.

I was excited to try a new ramen place in town. I figured, it's new so they are still hungry to impress. I was not impressed  (1) our bowls seemed to lack broth (2) I asked for extra noodles and expected it in my broth, but got it cold and stuck together like a ball on the side (3) we ordered a chicken charshu bowl. They gave it to us in a single rice bowl topped with chicken charshu. At least put it in a bigger bowl! I was forced to ask for an extra bowl so it was easier to eat. I gave them 3 stars because service was fast and they always checked on us when they passed by. I mean, we were 1 of 3 parties  I would be afraid to come if they were busy. Nonetheless, I went to meet friends for dinner and it was nice company. It's on the other side of town for us, so we may never go back given we pass so many other ramen places much worthier. I think this place will do okay given their location.

First time ever eating at this restaurant. It was a place my friends and I have never tried before so we wanted to give this place a shot since it was near our hotel in Vegas and was convenient. The food was really good for the price! My friend and I split the start me up karaage-don and it was a lot of karaage and rice enough for the both of us to eat. The karaage was crispy yet tender on the inside and the rice complimented the chicken very well. Our server, Lauren, was also great to us and overall was a good experience eating here!

Came here on my edc trip with a few friends, ordered the shinya way to heaven, and it was honestly pretty amazing. the black oil really gave my ramen the extra bump it needed, my bamboo tasted a little more sour than i was used to but omg the pork REALLY made up for it, everyone at my table agreed that the pork was delicious and would literally melt in your mouth. The waitress, unfortunately i forgot her name, was very kind, and attentive, our waters were never empty and she always made sure we had what we needed. it's good ramen for the price, especially being in vegas! will be coming back someday

Nice chill spot to grab a bite. This place perfect for big groups or date night. I loved the music, the service and the art. I wasn't too crazy about the ramen through. I must say I've had better, but I would go back again because  of vibes.

I first came here on the soft opening and got the vegan ramen. Everything was kind of just okay -- toppings, flavor, noodles. My main gripe was that the soup could have been warmer. But the service was friendly, we were asked about our experience by management on how they could improve, and it's also vegan ramen so I couldn't penalize this place too hard.

I came by again to give it another shot. I asked for extra garlic to add more flavor, and I received a bowl of lukewarm ramen with definitely no extra garlic. My friend's was also lukewarm, which made us both sad. There's nothing more unforgivable to me, someone who enjoys their food at a temperature that rivals the sun's, to receive a barely above room temperature bowl of soup.

I'm over-exaggerating, of course, but Shinya definitely has some bumps to smooth out.

I went for my lunch break. It's quick and close to my job so I had to try it plus the prices are fair for being so close to the strip. I ordered In Bloom ramen which is a vegan ramen. I recommend it, it's delicious.

Tasty pork and chicken broth (I ordered the double trouble chicken and friends ordered pork), the meats/ingredients were fresh, noodles were prepared perfect. Highly recommend. It took awhile due to the place being slammed with edc raver traffic which was a little annoying but the staff was super friendly - lengthy 40 minutes from ordering. The slaw with house dressing was awesome too.
